html: Chapters 30-31 continue the theme of Jehovah’s people relying on their own counsel and schemes (cf. Isaiah 28-29). Jehovah pronounces a “woe” or covenant curse on those who trust in an arm of flesh—that is, in man instead of in him. The terms “rebellious sons” designate those who renege on their covenant relationship with Jehovah (v 9; Isaiah 1:2; 63:8-10) by making human contingency “plans” or “schemes” (‘esa) and “alliances” or “agreements” (masseka), only adding sin to sin (Isaiah 28:15; 29:15-16). Their first sin is to backslide from Jehovah; their second is to supplant him with themselves.
